title: C94-1091

sentences.text: This paper presents an algorithm for selecting an appropriate classifier word for a noun .

In Thai language , it frequently happens that there is fluctuation in the choice of classifier for a given concrete noun , both from the point of view of the whole speech community and individual speakers .
Basically , there is no exact rule for classifier selection .
As far as we can do in the rule-based approach is to give a default rule to pick up a corresponding classifier of each noun .
Registration of classifier for each noun is limited to the type of unit classifier because other types are open due to the meaning of representation .

We propose a corpus-based method -LRB- Biber ,1993 ; Nagao ,1993 ; Smadja ,1993 -RRB- which generates Noun Classifier Associations -LRB- NCA -RRB- to overcome the problems in classifier assignment and semantic construction of noun phrase .
The NCA is created statistically from a large corpus and recomposed under concept hierarchy constraints and frequency of occurrences .

summary: This paper presents an algorithm for selecting an appropriate classifier word for a noun . In Thai language , it frequently happens that there is fluctuation in the choice of classifier for a given concrete noun , both from the point of view of the whole speech community and individual speakers . Basically , there is no exact rule for classifier selection . As far as we can do in the rule-based approach is to give a default rule to pick up a corresponding classifier of each noun . Registration of classifier for each noun is limited to the type of unit classifier because other types are open due to the meaning of representation . We propose a corpus-based method -LRB- Biber ,1993 ; Nagao ,1993 ; Smadja ,1993 -RRB- which generates Noun Classifier Associations -LRB- NCA -RRB- to overcome the problems in classifier assignment and semantic construction of noun phrase . The NCA is created statistically from a large corpus and recomposed under concept hierarchy constraints and frequency of occurrences .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates the act of introducing or offering something (in this case, an idea, concept, or solution), often in a formal or official manner. It implies that the subject has taken on the role of providing or sharing the object with others.

Predicate-happens_that_there_is_fluctuat.label: happens that there is fluctuation in the choice of classifier for a given concrete noun
Predicate-happens_that_there_is_fluctuat.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has an inherent property or tendency to exhibit variability in its use of classifiers when referring to specific types of nouns, which is described by the object. The connection between the subject and object lies in the idea that the subject's linguistic characteristics influence the way it uses classifiers for concrete objects.

Predicate-is_limited_to.label: is limited to
Predicate-is_limited_to.description: The predicate 'is limited to' indicates a restriction or boundary that applies to the subject. It suggests that the subject is confined within certain parameters, constraints, or guidelines defined by the object. In general, this predicate establishes a relationship between the subject and the object, implying that the subject's scope, range, or applicability are determined by the characteristics or properties of the object.

Predicate-generates.label: generates
Predicate-generates.description: The predicate 'generates' indicates a process of creation or production where the subject (a system, algorithm, or methodology) produces or brings into existence the object (an entity, concept, or relationship). This connection implies that the subject has an active role in shaping or generating the object, which may involve transforming input data, combining existing elements, or creating new patterns.

Predicate-created_from.label: created from
Predicate-created_from.description: The predicate 'created from' indicates that the subject (a concept or entity) has been derived or generated from the object (typically a source material, dataset, or corpus). This relationship suggests an origin or foundation for the subject's existence, identity, or characteristics.

Predicate-select.label: select
Predicate-select.description: The predicate 'select' indicates a process of choosing or designating one option from among multiple possibilities. It connects the subject (the entity making the selection) to the object (the chosen option), implying that the subject has intentionally identified and opted for the specific object.

Predicate-assigns.label: assigns
Predicate-assigns.description: The predicate 'assigns' indicates a relationship where the subject takes control or responsibility over the object, often implying a designation of purpose, function, or classification. This connection establishes a causal link between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject's action has an impact on the nature or meaning of the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or member of a more general category or class denoted by the object. In other words, it establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject is a subcategory or subclass of the object.
